pr_title: Generate SAML metadata for the Identity Provider

timeline.message:
Handle incoming AuthnRequests

- Expose an API that consumes (possibly signed) AuthnRequests as
defined by the HTTP-Redirect binding.
- Process AuthnRequests, validate and parse them into a minimum
set of information to be used for subsequent API calls to get a
SAML Response
address feedbacl and add Transport action tests

Generate SAML metadata for the Identity Provider

This change adds an API for generating SAML metadata for the
configured Identity Provider. All parameters that can contribute
to the metadata, from signing keys to Organization and contact
details are all configured in node settings.
The caller of the API needs to define the SP that will consume this
metadata as the values included can potentially be different,
depending on the registered SP configuration and the IDP policy.
Split Utils to Factory and Init, treat URLs as URLs
Support multiple allowed NameID formats per SP

Changes:

- Bring back the IDP wide signing credentials setup until we figure
out what to do with per SP signing credentials
- Make URL Settings URLs.

timeline.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: Not now. We're already implementing more than the absolute minimum we need. We really need to focus on MVP here.
replies.author: tvernum

timeline.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: They fixed the KeyDescriptorUnmarshaller but not the KeyDescriptorMarshaller 🤦‍♂
replies.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: I don't think Generate is needed in these names. SamlMetadataAction would be sufficient.
timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: There's no need to override this if it doesn't have a body.
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText: But ActionRequest#validate is abstract so I don't really have a choice :/
replies.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: Ah, so it is. Sorry, I forgot that was the case.
replies.author: tvernum

timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: Did you have a reason for putting this in the body rather than as a URL/query parameter?
timeline.author: tvernum

replies.bodyText:
No, I think I had this as a POST originally so that I wouldn't have to worry about the ugliness of
GET https://node1.example.com/_idp/saml/sp/https%3A%2F%2Fsp.entityid.org

On the other hand, GET makes sense and I thought I'd change it but the change was nto completed.
I assume we will be doing the same in the registration API ( with PUT in that case ). Thoughts?
replies.author: jkakavas

replies.bodyText: What you've got in the most recent commit is what I expected.
replies.author: tvernum

timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText: I'd probably change this name, based on what you decide to call the class.
timeline.author: tvernum

timeline.bodyText:
Tiny nit, our names typically end in _action.
TBH I don't know why - it's already obvious it's an action.
timeline.author: tvernum
